reg_info.full_title: O. Reg. 144/22: THE 2022 ROUND OF COLLECTIVE BARGAINING

content.content: 1. This Regulation applies with respect to the round of collective bargaining that begins in 2022.
content.raw_html: 1. This Regulation applies with respect to the round of collective bargaining that begins in 2022.

content.content: 2. (1) For the purposes of subsection 20 (5) of the Act, the deadline for applying to the Ontario Labour Relations Board for advice and notifying the Minister that an application has been made is March 31, 2022. (2) For the purposes of subsection 20 (8) of the Act, the deadline for applying to the Ontario Labour Relations Board for an order and notifying the Minister that an application has been made is April 14, 2022. (3) For the purposes of subsection 20.1 (5) of the Act, the period within which the notices mentioned in subsections 20.1 (2), (3) and (4) of the Act may be given starts on the day this Regulation is filed and ends on March 17, 2022.

2. (1) For the purposes of subsection 20 (5) of the Act, the deadline for applying to the Ontario Labour Relations Board for advice and notifying the Minister that an application has been made is March 31, 2022.

(2) For the purposes of subsection 20 (8) of the Act, the deadline for applying to the Ontario Labour Relations Board for an order and notifying the Minister that an application has been made is April 14, 2022.

(3) For the purposes of subsection 20.1 (5) of the Act, the period within which the notices mentioned in subsections 20.1 (2), (3) and (4) of the Act may be given starts on the day this Regulation is filed and ends on March 17, 2022.

content.content: 3. (1) The Canadian Union of Public Employees (“CUPE”) is designated under subsection 20 (2) of the Act as the employee bargaining agency for the employees of every school board in every bargaining unit for which CUPE or one of its affiliated trade unions is the bargaining agent. O. Reg. 463/22, s. 1. (2) A council of the following trustees’ associations is designated under subsection 21 (6) of the Act as the employer bargaining agency for a central table for central bargaining with respect to employees in the bargaining units for which CUPE is designated under subsection (1) of this section as the employee bargaining agency: 1. L’Association des conseils scolaires des écoles publiques de l’Ontario. 2. L’Association franco-ontarienne des conseils scolaires catholiques. 3. Ontario Catholic School Trustees’ Association. 4. Ontario Public School Boards’ Association. O. Reg. 463/22, s. 1. (3) A central table is established under subsection 23 (2) of the Act for central bargaining by CUPE with respect to all of the bargaining units for which it is designated under subsection (1) of this section as the employee bargaining agency. O. Reg. 463/22, s. 1.
